intro: Adenodolichos huillensis var. kawambwaensis, commonly known as the Kawambwa variation of the Huillén bean, is a leguminous plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It is characterized by its climbing habit and trifoliate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain edible seeds used in local cuisines. It thrives in high-altitude environments with well-drained soils and requires full sunlight. Its botanical significance lies in its adaptation to harsh Andean conditions and its role in traditional agriculture.
